dialogue.htmlContent:
You ask Helena out on a date (telling companion to leave if you have any first). She says she needs to get ready, so you will accompany her back to her apartment.

As you prepare to leave, Helena tells Scarlett to meet the two of you at her apartment; she can't be trusted to be left alone, so her day's over. Helena might have need of her, so she can't go home yet.

She has you wait in the opulent foyer while she travels up to get changed. Scarlett has already arrived.

Scarlett insults the harpy butler, who scurries off. Says Helena will let her go home when she comes back down, so doesn't see the point in hanging around.
You and Scarlett quietly wait for Helena to return.
You make smalltalk with Scarlett while you wait for Helena.
You ask Scarlett to set up a romantic scene in Helena's apartment. She says that she supposes she can help you.

Says that you'll be taking her to the hotel restaurant. Tells Scarlett that she can retire to her room (reveals that Scarlett is staying in one of her guest bedrooms as part of her duties as her PA).

You accompany Helena into the restaurant, get seated in the best place. Harpy waitress asks what you'd like to drink. Helena tells you that she wants wine.
You ask for some water. The harpy quickly returns with a glass of water. Helena is annoyed that you're not drinking wine with her.
You ask for a beer. The harpy quickly returns with a half-pint of beer. Helena is annoyed that you're not drinking wine with her.
You ask for some wine. The harpy quickly returns with a bottle of wine for you and Helena to share.
You ask for some whiskey. The harpy quickly returns with a glass of wine. Helena is annoyed that you're not drinking wine with her.
You and Helena decide upon what you want to eat. Harpy waitress takes your orders.
Topic of slavery. Helena mentions that there were protesters in Slaver Alley the other day, before she had the private security arrest them. Asks what your opinion on slaves is.
Repeat topic about slaves.
You say that slavery is natural; there are always hierarchies in nature, and slaves fit into their place at the bottom.
You say that slavery isn't something that you like, but you can see why it's necessary to keep law and order.
Slavery is wrong, and you only helped Helena because you thought that she'd be able to eventually work towards a slave-free business.

Topic of Harpy Nests. If player has cleared nests: She says about how she knows that you're the one who pacified the other matriarchs. Otherwise: She says that someone needs to pacify the other matriarchs. Says how it only takes the slightest thing to set harpies off. (She says how she's more refined and reasonable than them.)

She asks what you think of the way the Harpy Nests are managed...
Repeat topic about harpy nests.
You say that the other matriarchs should swear allegiance to Helena, so that she can keep them in check.
You say that things seem to have found a balance.
You say that the structure of harpy society leaves much to be desired.

Topic of which race is the most beautiful. Very disparaging comments about humans, saying that she's really doing human slaves a favour by transforming them into other races as specified by their new owners. She asks you which race you think is the most beautiful.
Repeat topic about races.
You flatter Helena by saying that harpies are the most beautiful, and she is unquestionably the most beautiful of all.
You say that beauty depends on the individual, not the race.
You say that looks are only skin deep, and it's a person's personality that reveals their true beauty.

She says how her dear Scarlett is far more beautiful, although her temperament leaves much to be desired. She expresses regret at having sold her to you. Says that despite her mannerisms, Scarlett is the most loyal of all of her followers.

You tell Helena that you are impressed by how she is able to control Scarlett.
You say that Scarlett is rude, but seems to be a loyal companion to Helena.

Helena thanks you for your help again, and says how she is getting filthy rich off it.
Repeat topic about business.
You flatter Helena by saying only she could have pulled it off so well.
You say that you should also be given credit for its success.
You say that you're surprised that it's so popular.
